comments.raw_text:
It should be reasonable easy to add something to nsNodeUtils::LastRelease
to update generated DOM node garbage counters per document.

Depending on what kinds of reports we'd want to create, counters should be updated only
if some pref is on.
If counting just numbers of objects is enough, then there shouldn't be need for such pref,
but if we'd want to call SizeOf methods, the virtual call etc. might make it too slow to be
active by default.

(I wonder if something similar could be done with JS Eng. If so, then taras' 'top' could
inform hopefully reasonable accurate numbers of what tab is causing garbage.)
